page.title: 11Walks from Kirtlington
page.content: There are a lot of walks for recreation from Kirtlington. If you don't want to walk a long way you can go round South Green, past the ancient Manor House to the Church, up Troy Lane, past the Oxford Arms, Dashwood Arms and back to the school. For another walk start from The Pound, go along Crowcastle Lane to Northbrook. Then you cross the Oxford Canal and the River Cherwell to Tackley. Cross the railway and fields back towards Kirtlington via Mill Lane. For a third circular walk, enter the Park from South Green. You can walk across the Park, past the big house, down to the polo ground, across Akeman Street and to Slade Farm. From the farm walk to Northbrook and back to the village, by Crowcastle Lane. Another walk is part of the Oxfordshire Way. It comes from Tackley, crosses Kirtlington Park on its way to Weston-on-the-Green.
